intro: Edraianthus vesovicii, commonly known as the Vesovici's edraianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing white or pale blue flowers that are attractive to pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
